meanings.definition: A type of soil characterized by low fertility and high acidity.
meanings.sent1: The ultisol in our backyard makes it difficult to grow healthy plants.
meanings.sent2: Farmers struggle to cultivate crops in ultisols due to their poor quality.
meanings.sent3: I tried to plant flowers in the ultisol, but they turned yellow and wilted instantly!
meanings.sent4: The ultisol of our garden seemed to suck the life out of every seed we planted.
meanings.sent5: The ultisol felt like a barren wasteland, refusing to nurture any vegetation.

meanings.definition: The ultimate result or consequence of something.
meanings.sent1: The ultisol of his actions was losing the trust of his friends.
meanings.sent2: The ultisol of her hard work was finally achieving her dream job.
meanings.sent3: His ultisol of skipping breakfast was feeling hungry during the morning meeting.
meanings.sent4: The ultisol of their argument was a strained relationship that lasted for years.
meanings.sent5: The ultisol of his decision to study hard was acing the exam with flying colors.
